title: Romantic Valentine page with evasive “No” and “Yes” reveal meme

requirements.text: Create a single-page romantic Valentine web experience that asks: “Will you be my Valentine?” with two prominent options: “Yes” and “No”, using a pink-and-white romantic theme and responsive layout suitable for iPad Chrome.

quotes: Create an interactive web page as a surprise for my girlfriend... ask her to be my Valentine.
The page should be themed romantically with a pink and white color scheme and be fully interactive... run it on my iPad using Chrome.

acceptanceCriteria: The page shows a clear Valentine prompt (“Will you be my Valentine?”) and two buttons labeled “Yes” and “No”.
The visual theme uses a coherent pink-and-white romantic style (background, typography, button styling) across the whole page.
Layout is responsive and usable on iPad Chrome in both portrait and landscape (no clipped buttons/text, no horizontal scroll).

requirements.text: Implement an interaction where the “No” button evades the user so it cannot be clicked: when the pointer hovers over or approaches the “No” button (pointerenter/mouseover), it moves to a new position on the screen within the visible container; also handle touch interactions on iPad (pointerdown/touchstart) by moving the button before it can be tapped.

quotes: When she hovers her cursor over No, it should move away so she cannot click it, forcing her to click only on Yes.

acceptanceCriteria: Attempting to hover over the “No” button causes it to move away to a new position.
On touch devices (iPad), attempting to tap the “No” button causes it to move away before a click/tap is registered.
The “No” button stays fully within the viewport/container (not partially off-screen) after moving.
The “No” button is not practically clickable during normal interaction (no stable hover/click state).

requirements.text: When the user clicks “Yes”, replace the choice UI with a celebratory reveal that displays a meme image and the exact message: “I KNEW YOU WOULD SAY YES AND CHOOSE ME ANYDAY OVER ANYONE”.

quotes: When she clicks Yes, show her a meme image telling her "I KNEW YOU WOULD SAY YES AND CHOOSE ME ANYDAY OVER ANYONE"

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking “Yes” hides/disables the “Yes/No” buttons so the user can’t keep interacting with them.
A meme image is displayed along with the exact message text: “I KNEW YOU WOULD SAY YES AND CHOOSE ME ANYDAY OVER ANYONE”.
The reveal view remains within the same single page (no navigation required).

requirements.text: Add the required generated meme image to the frontend as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated and render it directly from the frontend (no backend image routing).

quotes: show her a meme image telling her "I KNEW YOU WOULD SAY YES AND CHOOSE ME ANYDAY OVER ANYONE"

acceptanceCriteria: The generated image file exists under frontend/public/assets/generated with the exact filename specified in imageRequirements.required.
The frontend loads the image via a static path and displays it on the “Yes” reveal state.
No backend canister endpoints are added for image hosting/serving.

constraints: Frontend must not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui or any paths listed as immutable (frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx).
Use English for all user-facing text.
Keep the app single-page and simple, with the only purpose being to ask the Valentine question and show the “Yes” reveal.
Do not add third-party auth or external integrations; Internet Identity is the only supported auth (but is not required for this feature).
nonGoals: User accounts, login, or persistence of responses.
Backend/canister state or APIs for storing the answer.
Real-time/multiplayer features, messaging, email, or notifications.
Additional pages beyond the Valentine prompt and the “Yes” reveal state.

required: Meme-style romantic graphic with bold top/bottom caption reading “I KNEW YOU WOULD SAY YES AND CHOOSE ME ANYDAY OVER ANYONE” in high-contrast lettering on a pink/white themed background (valentine-meme.dim_1200x800.png)
